document.docAuthor: Mantelatto, Fernando L., Miranda, Ivana, Vera-Silva, Ana L., Negri, Mariana, Buranelli, Raquel C., Terossi, Mariana, Magalhães, Tatiana, Costa, Rogério C., Zara, Fernando J. & Castilho, Antonio L.
document.masterDocTitle: Checklist of decapod crustaceans from the coast of the São Paulo state (Brazil) supported by integrative molecular and morphological data: IV. Infraorder Anomura: Superfamilies Chirostyloidea, Galatheoidea, Hippoidea and Paguroidea

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist of decapod crustaceans from the coast of the São Paulo state (Brazil) supported by integrative molecular and morphological data: IV. Infraorder Anomura: Superfamilies Chirostyloidea, Galatheoidea, Hippoidea and Paguroidea

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks.
Petrolisthes armatus
is an euryhaline species that inhabits mangrove regions, living on root branches of
Rhizophora sp.
and
Avicenia sp.
and in small lagoons. It is also found in the intertidal region, under rocks, on corals, sponges, reefs built by
Phragmatopoma caudata Krøyer
in Mörch, 1863, mussel beds and oysters down to 60 m depth ( Werding 1977 , 1982 ; Veloso & Melo 1993 ; Micheletti-Flores & Negreiros-Fransozo 1999 ; Hollebone & Hay 2007 , 2008 ;
Macedo et al. 2012
). Recent studies have reported that
P. armatus
is not a species complex but a single species with large distribution and high variability (
Mantelatto et al. 2011
; Hiller & Lessios 2017 ). In addition, it has been cited as an invasive species, expanding its distribution by in advertent transportation alongside oysters and seed clams for use in the aquaculture industry (
Knott et al. 2000
;
Wassick et al. 2017
;
Mack et al. 2019
). Sequences accession numbers (GenBank): CCDB 1747—16S ( HM352475 ), CCDB 5185—COI ( MF490061 ) (
Mantelatto et al. 2011
, 2018).
